title: Google\Cloud\Firestore\WriteBatch
name: WriteBatch
description:
Enqueue and write multiple mutations to Cloud Firestore.

This class may be used directly for multiple non-transactional writes. To run changes in a transaction (with automatic retry/rollback on failure), use Google\Cloud\Firestore\Transaction. Single modifications can be made using the various methods on Google\Cloud\Firestore\DocumentReference.

params.name: transaction
params.description: The transaction to run commits in. Defaults to null.

methods.name: create
methods.description:
Enqueue a document creation.

This operation will fail (when committed) if the document already exists.

params.name: document
params.description: The document to target, either as a string document name, or DocumentReference object. Please note that DocumentReferences will be used only for the document name. Field data must be provided in the $fields argument.

params.name: fields
params.description: An array containing fields, where keys are the field names, and values are field values. Nested arrays are allowed. Note that unlike Google\Cloud\Firestore\DocumentReference::update(), field paths are NOT supported by this method.

exceptions.description: If `FieldValue::deleteField()` is found in the fields list.
If `FieldValue::serverTimestamp()` is found in an array value.

methods.name: set
methods.description:
Enqueue a set mutation.

Unless $options['merge'] is set to `true, this method replaces all fields in a Firestore document.

params.name: document
params.description: The document to target, either as a string document name, or DocumentReference object. Please note that DocumentReferences will be used only for the document name. Field data must be provided in the $fields argument.

params.name: fields
params.description: An array containing fields, where keys are the field names, and values are field values. Nested arrays are allowed. Note that unlike Google\Cloud\Firestore\WriteBatch::update(), field paths are NOT supported by this method.

params.name: options.merge
params.description: If true, unwritten fields will be preserved. Otherwise, they will be overwritten (removed). Defaults to false.

exceptions.description:
If `FieldValue::deleteField()` is found in the document when `$options.merge`
is not `true`.
If `FieldValue::serverTimestamp()` is found in an array value.

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Enqueue an update with field paths and values.

Merges provided data with data stored in Firestore.

Calling this method on a non-existent document will raise an exception.

This method supports various sentinel values, to perform special operations on fields. Available sentinel values are provided as methods, found in Google\Cloud\Firestore\FieldValue.

Note that field names must be provided using field paths, encoded either as a dot-delimited string (i.e. foo.bar), or an instance of Google\Cloud\Firestore\FieldPath. Nested arrays are not allowed.

Please note that conflicting paths will result in an exception. Paths conflict when one path indicates a location nested within another path. For instance, path a.b cannot be set directly if path a is also provided.

examples.caption: Google Cloud PHP provides special field values to enable operations such as deleting fields or setting the value to the current server timestamp.
If your field names contain special characters (such as ., or symbols), using Google\Cloud\Firestore\FieldPath will properly escape each element.

params.name: document
params.description: The document to target, either as a string document name, or DocumentReference object. Please note that DocumentReferences will be used only for the document name. Field data must be provided in the $data argument.

params.name: data
params.description: A list of arrays of form [FieldPath|string $path, mixed $value].

exceptions.description:
If data is given in an invalid format
or is empty.
If any field paths are empty.

params.name: document
params.description: The document to target, either as a string document name, or DocumentReference object.
